1: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall. - Nelson Mandela
2: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing. - Walt Disney
3: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. - Steve Jobs
4: If life were predictable it would cease to be life, and be without flavor. - Eleanor Roosevelt
5: If you look at what you have in life, you'll always have more. - Oprah Winfrey
6: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans. - John Lennon
7: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
8: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years. - Abraham Lincoln
9: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams. - Eleanor Roosevelt
10: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light. - Aristotle
11: Whoever is happy will make others happy too. - Anne Frank
12: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are. - Theodore Roosevelt
13: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts. - Winston Churchill
14: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
15: You will face many defeats in life, but never let yourself be defeated. - Maya Angelou
16: Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about. - Marilyn Monroe
17: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin. - Tony Robbins
18: Only a life lived for others is a life worthwhile. - Albert Einstein
19: Do not let making a living prevent you from making a life. - John Wooden
20: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity. - Albert Einstein
21: Life is made of ever so many partings welded together. - Charles Dickens
22: The purpose of our lives is to be happy. - Dalai Lama
23: Love the life you live. Live the life you love. - Bob Marley
24: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated. - Confucius
25: May you live all the days of your life. - Jonathan Swift
26: Life itself is the most wonderful fairy tale. - Hans Christian Andersen
27: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment. - Buddha
28: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn. - Benjamin Franklin
29: It always seems impossible until it's done. - Nelson Mandela
30: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today. - Franklin D. Roosevelt
31: We know what we are, but know not what we may be. - William Shakespeare
32: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken. - Oscar Wilde
33: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe. - Albert Einstein
34: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
35: The best way to predict your future is to create it. - Peter Drucker
36: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take. - Wayne Gretzky
37: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work. - Thomas Edison
38: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it. - Henry David Thoreau
39: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going. - Sam Levenson
40: If you can dream it, you can do it. - Walt Disney
41: A goal is not always meant to be reached, it often serves simply as something to aim at. - Bruce Lee
42: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop. - Confucius
43: Believe you can and you're halfway there. - Theodore Roosevelt
44: The secret of getting ahead is getting started. - Mark Twain
45: Opportunities don't happen. You create them. - Chris Grosser
46: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does. - William James
47: Success is how high you bounce when you hit bottom. - George S. Patton
48: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny. - C.S. Lewis
49: Do one thing every day that scares you. - Eleanor Roosevelt
50: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals. - Zig Ziglar
